verses.english: And Tobias said, “Sister, because of you, the Lord preserved our lives and delivered us from the power of the demon, and our life has now become good.”

verses.latin: Ideo laudate Dominum, et celebremus nomen ejus, qui fecit nos salvos.
verses.english: “Therefore, praise the Lord, and let us celebrate His name, who made us safe.”

verses.latin: Et factum est post verba hæc, ut Thobias et Sara surrexerunt, et cum gaudio se amplexi sunt, et benedixerunt Dominum.
verses.english: And it happened after these words that Tobias and Sara rose up, and they joyfully embraced each other and blessed the Lord.

verses.latin: Et Thobias dixit: Benedictus es, Domine Deus noster, qui benedicis nos in omnibus, et salvas animas nostras de inferno.
verses.english: And Tobias said, “Blessed are You, O Lord our God, who blesses us in all things and saves our souls from hell.”

verses.latin: Benedictus es, qui facis mirabilia magna, et liberas nos de morte.
verses.english: “Blessed are You, who does great wonders and delivers us from death.”

verses.latin: Benedictus es, qui creasti omnia, et gubernas omnia.
verses.english: “Blessed are You, who created all things and governs all things.”

verses.latin: Benedictus es, qui es in cælo et in terra, et in omnibus creaturis tuis.
verses.english: “Blessed are You, who are in the sky and on the earth, and in all Your creatures.”

verses.latin: Ut autem consummata est coena, introduxerunt ad Tobiam Saram.
verses.english: When the wedding feast was finished, they led Sara to young Tobiah.

verses.latin: Et reminiscens Tobias sermonum angeli, protulit de sacculo suo partem jecoris piscis, et posuit super carbones vivos.
verses.english: And Tobiah, remembering the angel’s words, took a portion of the fish’s liver from his satchel and placed it upon burning coals.

verses.latin: Tum Raphael angelus apprehendit dæmonem, et alligavit eum in deserto superioris Ægypti.
verses.english: Then the Archangel Raphael seized the demon and bound him in the desert lands of Upper Egypt.

verses.latin: Exsurgens autem Tobias de lecto, dixit ad eam: Surge, Sara, et deprecemur Deum hodie, et cras, et perendie: quia istis tribus noctibus jungimur Domino: et cum tertia nox fuerit transierit, ut in conjugio nostro permaneamus.
verses.english: But Tobiah, rising from the bed, said to her, 'Rise, Sara, and let us pray to God today, tomorrow, and the day after tomorrow. For these first three nights, we are dedicating ourselves to the Lord. After the third night has passed, we shall consummate our marriage fully.'

verses.latin: Quoniam filii sanctorum sumus, et non possumus jungimur ita ut gentes, quae ignorant Deum.
verses.english: For we are the children of saints, and it is not fitting for us to unite ourselves as those pagans do, who do not know God.

verses.latin: Et surrexerunt ambo, et simul orabant instanter ut incolumes fierent.
verses.english: And both of them rose, and they prayed together earnestly that they might be kept safe and unharmed.

verses.latin: Et dixit: Benedico te, Deus patrum nostrorum, et benedico nomen tuum sanctum et gloriosum in saecula saeculorum. Benedicant te caeli, et universae creaturae tuae.
verses.english: And he prayed, saying, 'I bless You, O God of our fathers, and I bless Your holy and glorious Name unto ages of ages. May all creation, both the heavens and all Your creatures, bless You.'

verses.latin: Et nunc Domine, tu scis, quia non libidine, sed propter solam sobolem accepi sororem meam hanc, in qua benedicatur nomen tuum in saecula saeculorum.
verses.english: And now, O Lord, You know that it is not out of lust that I have taken this kinswoman of mine, but solely for the sake of begetting children. May Your Name be blessed through her unto ages of ages.

verses.latin: Et dixit Sara: Miserere nostri, Domine, miserere nostri, et fac nos in senectute simul commorari.
verses.english: And Sara also prayed, saying, 'Have mercy on us, O Lord, have mercy on us, and grant that we may dwell together into old age.'

verses.latin: Et aurora facto, jusserat Raguel servos suos, ut foderent foveam, et sepelirent eum, ne forte evaderet illi quod factum est septem viris.
verses.english: And when dawn broke, Raguel commanded his servants to dig a grave and bury Tobiah, lest the same fate that befell the seven previous husbands should also befall him.

verses.latin: Fodiunt, et parant illi sepulcrum.
verses.english: So they dug and prepared a grave for him.

verses.latin: Revertitur autem socer ad uxorem suam, et dicit ei: Mitte unam ex famulabus tuis, et videat si mortuus est, ut sepeliamus eum, nequis nos recognoscat.
verses.english: But Raguel, the father-in-law, returned to his wife Edna and said to her, 'Send one of your servant-girls to see if he is dead, so that we may bury him before anyone finds out and shames us.'

verses.latin: Et misit unam ex famulabus suis, quae ingressa cubiculum, invenit eos salvos, et in uno lecto dormientes.
verses.english: So she sent one of her servant-girls, who, upon entering the chamber, found them safe and sound, sleeping together in the same bed.

verses.latin: Et reversa nuntiavit eis gaudium: et benedixit unusquisque Deum Judæorum quod evaderet illi.
verses.english: And returning, she announced the joyful news to them. And each person blessed the God of the Jews for having preserved Tobiah.

verses.latin: Et Raguel laudavit Dominum, et dixit: Benedictus es, Domine Deus, omni benedictione munda: ita ut benedicant te in omnibus saeculis.
verses.english: And Raguel praised the Lord and said, 'Blessed are You, O Lord God, with every pure blessing, so that Your holy Name may be blessed in all ages.'

verses.latin: Et laudent te caeli et omnis creatura tua, et duo angeli tui sancti.
verses.english: May the heavens praise You, and all Your creation, and Your two holy angels.

verses.latin: Benedicat te in omnibus saeculis quia lætificasti me, et non contristasti.
verses.english: May all bless You in all ages, because You have made me joyful and have not brought me sorrow.

verses.latin: Et benedico te, quia fecisti tecum habere misericordiam cum duobus unicis meis.
verses.english: And I bless You because You have shown Your mercy upon my two dear and unique children.

verses.latin: Fac illos, Domine, consummare in senectute sine querela.
verses.english: Grant, O Lord, that they may reach old age together without complaint.

verses.latin: Et omnibus diebus vitae suae serviant tibi: et benedicant tibi omni tempore.
verses.english: And may they serve You all the days of their lives, and bless You at all times.

verses.latin: Et tunc jussit convivium magnum fieri, et in epulis suis septem diebus epulari.
verses.english: And then Raguel commanded a great wedding feast to be held, and they celebrated and feasted for seven days.

verses.latin: Tunc vocavit Tobias angelum secum, et dixit ei: Azaria, frater, quaeso te, ut assumas tecum famulos et camelos, et vadas in Rages civitatem Medorum, ad Gabael, et reddas ei chirographum suum, et recipias ab eo pecuniam.
verses.english: Then Tobias called the angel, who had been traveling as Azariah, to him. Tobias said, 'My brother Azariah, I ask you to take servants and camels with you. Go to Rages, the city in Media, to Gabael, and give him back his bond—the record of the money we lent him—and receive the money from him.'

verses.latin: Et adducas eum ad nuptias meas: scio enim quod pater meus dierum meorum numerum computat, et si moram fecero vel una die, valde contristabitur.
verses.english: And bring Gabael back with you to my wedding. For I know that my father is keeping track of the days I have been away, and if I delay even one more day, he will be very sorrowful.

verses.latin: Et Raphael assumpsit famulos et camelos, et profectus est in Rages civitatem Medorum ad Gabael, et dedit ei chirographum, et recepit ab eo omnem pecuniam.
verses.english: So Raphael, revealing his true identity through his actions, took the servants and camels. He set out for Rages, the city in Media, to Gabael, and returned his bond, receiving all the money from him.

verses.latin: Et adduxit secum Gabael ad nuptias. Et benedixit Gabael Tobiae puero et uxori ejus Sarrae et matri ejus.
verses.english: Raphael then brought Gabael with him to the wedding celebration. Gabael blessed Tobias, the young man, and his wife Sarah, and Tobias's mother.

verses.latin: Et post septem dies celebrationis nuptiarum redierunt.
verses.english: After the seven days of wedding festivities were completed, Raphael and Gabael returned to Tobias and Sarah.

verses.latin: Tunc Tobias vocavit Angelum secum, quem hominem arbitrabatur, et dixit ei: Azaria frater, rogo te ut assumas tecum servos, et camelos, et vadas in Rages civitatem Medorum, ad Gabael, et reddas ei chirographum meum, et pecuniam. Et reducas eum ad nuptias.
verses.english: Then Tobias called the Angel, whom he thought was a man, to himself and said to him: "Brother Azarias, I ask you to take servants and camels with you, and go to Rages, a city of the Medes, to Gabael. Give him my bond for the money and collect it. Then, bring him back here for my wedding."

verses.latin: Scis enim quoniam Pater meus numerat dies, et si tardior fuero vel una die, valde contristabitur.
verses.english: You know that my father is counting the days, and if I am late even by a single day, he will be very sad.

verses.latin: Et Raphaël assumpsit secum quatuor ex servis ejus, et duos camelos, et perrexit in Rages civitatem Medorum, et invenit Gabael, et dedit ei chirographum ejus, et recepit ab eo omnem pecuniam.
verses.english: And Raphael took four of Tobias's servants and two camels with him. He traveled to Rages, the city of the Medes, and found Gabael. He gave him Tobias's bond and received all the money from him.

verses.latin: Indixit quoque ei de Tobia adolescente, quæcumque gesta fuerant: et duxit Gabael secum ad nuptias.
verses.english: Raphael also informed Gabael about everything that had happened to young Tobias. Then, he brought Gabael back with him for the wedding.

verses.latin: Et venit in nuptias Tobit, benedicens Dominum, quia honorificasset Tobiam.
verses.english: And Gabael came to the wedding of Tobias, blessing the Lord, because God had shown great favor to Tobias.

verses.latin: Haec autem omnia post dies septem facta sunt: et fecerunt cum timore magno omnes nuptias ejus.
verses.english: Now, all these things happened after seven days, and everyone celebrated the wedding with great reverence for God.

verses.latin: Interea Tobias in itinere erat, et Anna quotidie sedebat secus viam, qua filius ejus profectus fuerat.
verses.english: Meanwhile, Tobias was on his journey back home. Anna, his mother, sat every day by the road from which her son had departed, waiting for him.

verses.latin: Et attenta facie circumspiciebat, si forte veniret; et cum neminem videret, reponebat lamentum, et hanc vocem emittebat:
verses.english: With an attentive face, she would look around, hoping he might appear; and when she saw no one, she would resume her lament, uttering this cry:

verses.latin: Heu me, fili mi, ut quid te misimus foras, lumen oculorum nostrorum, baculum senectutis nostrae, solatium vitae nostrae, spem posteritatis nostrae?
verses.english: “Oh, my son! Why did we send you out, you who are the light of our eyes, the staff of our old age, the comfort of our life, the hope of our future generations?”

verses.latin: Pedibus nostris in te vacua est sollicitudo.
verses.english: Our worry for you makes our every step feel empty and useless.

verses.latin: Utinam non te misissemus! sed utinam nos ipsi mortui essemus, ut non videremus hanc nostram omnem moestitiam.
verses.english: “If only we had not sent you! And if only we ourselves had died, so that we would not have to see all this sorrow we now endure.”

verses.latin: Et Thobi pater ejus dicebat illi: Quiesce, et noli conturbari, soror nostra: sanus est filius noster: bonus est nuntius, et qui erat in itinere, frater noster, salvus est: omnes in bono venient.
verses.english: And Tobit, his father, kept telling her: “Calm down, and do not be troubled, my sister. Our son is healthy; the news is good. Our kinsman who was with him on the journey is safe. They will all come home well.”

verses.latin: Et Anna non acquiescebat lacrymis, sed assidue circumspiciebat in viam, quacumque filius ejus profectus fuerat.
verses.english: But Anna did not cease her tears, but instead, she continually kept watching the road from which her son had departed.

verses.latin: Et ecce quædam die, videns canem venientem, stabat et dicebat:
verses.english: And behold, one certain day, seeing the dog coming, she stood up and exclaimed:

verses.latin: Filius meus venit! et protinus exiens obviam filio suo, occurrit illi, et apprehendit eum, et deosculabatur, et dicebat:
verses.english: “My son is coming!” And immediately going out to meet her son, she ran to him, and embraced him, and kept kissing him, saying:

verses.latin: Gratias tibi ago, Deus, quia venisti! et protinus mater ejus et pater ejus, et omnes amici sui, exierunt obviam illi.
verses.english: “Thank you, God, because you have returned him to me!” And immediately, his mother and his father, and all their friends, went out to meet him.

verses.latin: Et intrantes domum, et ponentes Tobiam super lectum, pater ejus ait illi: Nunc, fili mi, ad præparandum te accede.
verses.english: And upon entering the house, and placing Tobias on the bed, his father said to him: “Now, my son, get ready to prepare yourself for healing.”

verses.latin: Et dixit Tobias: In principio Dei, omnes me benedixit Deus; quoniam ecce Ego veni, et sana me, Deus.
verses.english: And Tobias said: “From the very start, by the power of God, God has blessed me in every way; for behold, I have come, and now, God, heal me.”

verses.latin: Et apprehensit Tobiam pater ejus, et dixit illi: Benedictus es, fili mi, in omni tempore!
verses.english: And his father embraced Tobias, and said to him: “Blessed are you, my son, at all times!”

verses.latin: Et dixit Anna mater ejus: Quoniam in vita mea non vidi te in bono; nunc te benedicit Deus omnipotens!
verses.english: And Anna, his mother, said: “Since in my life I have not seen you in prosperity until now; may Almighty God now bless you!”

verses.latin: Inter haec, Tobit pater ejus quotidie sollicitus erat, et numerabat noctes et dies temporis, quod constituerat, et expleta die, cum non adveniret filius ejus,
verses.english: While these things were happening in Ecbatana, Tobias’s father, Tobit, was anxious every day. He counted the nights and days of the time he had agreed upon for his son's return, and when that day was completed, and his son had not yet arrived,

verses.latin: dicebat: Numquid detentus est Tobias? aut numquid Simon cum illo moratus est? aut forsitan defunctus est Tobias? vel certe detentus est.
verses.english: he kept saying: 'Is Tobias perhaps delayed? Or has Raguel kept him with him? Or perhaps Tobias has died? Or surely, he is being held back.'

verses.latin: Et sic affligebatur, et incipiebat graviter desperare, et dicere:
verses.english: And thus he was afflicted, and began to gravely despair, saying:

verses.latin: Heu me! fili mi, utinam non misissem te: lux oculorum meorum, tecum vadens, sublata est.
verses.english: 'Woe is me, my son! If only I had not sent you! The light of my eyes, which went with you, has been taken away from me.'

verses.latin: Mater quoque ejus Anna quotidie sedebat secus viam super quam profectus filius suus erat, respiciens procul si forte veniret:
verses.english: His mother, Anna, also sat daily by the roadside where her son had departed, looking into the distance, hoping he might come:

verses.latin: et cum videret desertam viam, coepit plorare, et dicere:
verses.english: and when she saw the road deserted, she began to cry, and say:

verses.latin: Heu me! fili mi, ut quid te misimus, lumen oculorum nostrorum? sedens in conspectu. Tu es baculus senectutis nostrae, tu es spes vitae nostrae, tu es regimen nostrum. Nam et nos cum tecum fuimus, habuimus omnia: et tu cum a nobis abiisti, sumus in paupertate.
verses.english: 'Woe is me, my son! Why did we send you, the very light of our eyes? You are the support for our old age, the hope of our life, our very guidance. For when you were with us, we had everything, but since you have gone from us, we are now in poverty.'

verses.latin: Porro Raphael dixit Tobiae: Nostin’ frater, qualiter reliquisti patrem tuum?
verses.english: Moreover, Raphael said to Tobias: 'Do you not know, brother, how you left your father?'

verses.latin: Nonne admonuit te ut honorares patrem et matrem tuam?
verses.english: Did he not admonish you to honor your father and your mother?

verses.latin: Et nunc, si placet tibi, revertere ad patrem tuum quantocyus: et ego ire praecedam te, et erit tibi cura cum eo, et cum uxore tua Sarra, et cum ancillis tuis, et cum pecoribus.
verses.english: And now, if it pleases you, return to your father as quickly as you can. I will go ahead of you, and you will then be able to take care of him, your wife Sarah, your maidservants, and your livestock.

verses.latin: Et Tobias, licet tristis esset, eo quod uxorem suam relinquens, sic eam haberet, tamen annuit angelo, quod sic faceret.
verses.english: And Tobias, though he was sad because he would be leaving his wife in this manner, nevertheless agreed with the angel to do so.

verses.latin: Dixitque Tobias uxori suae: Sara, surge, et vado ad patrem meum; quia scio quia pater meus et mater mea solliciti sunt in corde suo.
verses.english: And Tobias said to his wife: 'Sarah, get up, and I will go to my father; for I know that my father and my mother are anxious in their hearts.'

verses.latin: Et surgens mulier, et filius, et ancillae, et omne pecus, quodcumque erat eis, exierunt de Ecba tanis, et perrexerunt ad domum patris ejus in Niniven.
verses.english: And rising up, the woman, and the son, and the maidservants, and all the livestock they possessed, they departed from Ecbatana, and went on their way to his father’s house in Nineveh.

verses.latin: Et cum pervenissent ad Caserin, quae est contra Niniven, dixit Raphael: Scis, frater, quomodo dimiseris patrem tuum?
verses.english: When they reached Caserin, which is located across from Nineveh, Raphael said to Tobias, "Brother, you know how you left your father behind, don't you?"

verses.latin: Si placet ergo tibi, festinemus ante equos, et ingrediatur mater tua, et uxor tua, et armenta.
verses.english: "If it pleases you, let us hurry on ahead of the horses and the rest of your family, so your mother, your wife, and the animals can follow."

verses.latin: Et cum irent, dixit ad eum: Tolle tecum de felle piscis, quia necesse habes.
verses.english: As they continued on their journey, Raphael said to Tobias, "Take some of the fish's gall with you, because you will certainly need it."

verses.latin: Et abiit Tobias, et canis secutus est eum.
verses.english: So Tobias went on ahead, and his dog followed close behind him.

verses.latin: Anna vero sedebat secus viam super speculam, unde prospicere poterat procul.
verses.english: Meanwhile, Anna, Tobias's mother, was sitting by the roadside on a lookout point, from which she could see far into the distance.

verses.latin: Et dum illuc suspiceret, vidit procul adventum ejus, et statim cognovit filium suum venientem: et currens nuntiavit marito suo, dicens: Ecce venit filius tuus.
verses.english: As she gazed out, she saw his arrival from afar and immediately recognized her son coming towards her. Running quickly, she announced to her husband, "Look, your son is coming!"

verses.latin: Et exilivit Tobis de strato, et pedes impingebat, et per viam perrexit, et cucurrit ad occursum filii sui.
verses.english: And Tobit, his father, leaped from his bed, stumbling with his feet, and went out onto the road, running to meet his son.

verses.latin: Et perveniens ad eum, apprehendit eum, et Sara uxor ejus, et Anna mater ejus: et omnes cum gaudio, quod pervenisset sanus.
verses.english: When Tobit reached him, he embraced Tobias, as did Sarah, Tobias's wife, and Anna, his mother. Everyone was filled with joy because he had returned healthy and safe.

verses.latin: Et tenens manum filii sui, venit, et superposuit super oculos ejus de felle piscis, quem tulerat de pisciculo.
verses.english: Holding his son's hand, Tobit came and applied some of the fish's gall, which Tobias had brought from the small fish, onto his father's eyes.

verses.latin: Et circa triginta dies postea, aperuit oculos suos, et vidit filium suum.
verses.english: After approximately thirty days, Tobit opened his eyes and was able to see his son again.

verses.latin: Et procidens super collum ejus, ploravit, et dixit: Video te, fili mi, lux oculorum meorum.
verses.english: Falling upon his son's neck, Tobit wept and exclaimed, "I see you, my son, you are the light of my eyes!"

verses.latin: Et dixit Anna uxor ejus: Quoniam video te, fili, amodo mori licebit mihi.
verses.english: His wife, Anna, also said, "Now that I see you, my son, I am content to die."

verses.latin: Et facta est domus eorum plena lætitia, et benedixerunt Deum.
verses.english: Their house was filled with great joy, and they all blessed God for His mercy.

verses.latin: Et vocatum est convivium magnum, et steterunt per septem dies, et benedixerunt Dominum.
verses.english: A great feast was prepared, and the celebration lasted for seven days, during which they continued to bless the Lord.

verses.latin: Et vocavit Tobis Raphael, et dixit ei: Precipe ei, frater, et dabo tibi dimidiam partem omnium, quae adduximus.
verses.english: Then Tobit called Raphael and said to him, "Brother, command me, and I will give you half of everything we have brought back."

verses.latin: Et dixit illi Raphael: Non sit tibi grave, quia ego sum angelus Raphael, unus ex septem, qui assistimus ante Deum.
verses.english: Raphael replied to him, "Do not be troubled by this, for I am the angel Raphael, one of the seven holy angels who stand before God Himself."

verses.latin: Et dixit ei Tobis: Quid est, quod dixisti?
verses.english: Tobit said to him, "What is it you have just revealed?"

verses.latin: Et respondens dixit Raphael: Non est mihi, ut celarem vos hoc verbum. Scio enim, quod omnia beneficia Dei in vobis sunt.
verses.english: Raphael answered, "It is not for me to conceal this truth from you. For I know that all of God's blessings are truly in you."

verses.latin: Et intrantibus illis domum, benedixerunt Dominum. Et factum est convivium magnum, et gaudebat Tobis.
verses.english: As they all entered the house, they blessed the Lord. A great feast was made, and Tobit rejoiced greatly.

verses.latin: Et abiit Tobias, et canis simul cum eo, et secutus est eos Raphael.
verses.english: And Tobias left, and his dog was with him, and Raphael followed them.

verses.latin: Et cum adhuc irent, dixit ad eum Raphael: Scimus, quia pater tuus lumen oculorum recipiet.
verses.english: And while they were still traveling, Raphael said to Tobias: "We know that your father will regain the light of his eyes."

verses.latin: Tu vero hoc modo facies: Cum intraveris domum tuam, statim adora Dominum Deum tuum: et gratias age ei, et appropinqua ad patrem tuum, et osculare illum.
verses.english: "But you must do it this way: When you enter your house, immediately worship the Lord your God, and give Him thanks. Then approach your father and kiss him."

verses.latin: Et statim unge de felle piscis oculos ejus, quem tecum abstulisti. Et scimus quia statim aperientur oculi ejus, et pater tuus in gaudio tuo videbit lumen cæli.
verses.english: "And immediately rub the fish's gall on his eyes, the one you brought with you. And we know that his eyes will open at once, and your father, in your joy, will see the light of the sky."

verses.latin: Tunc canis, qui fuerat cum eis in via, accurrens prævertit nuntium, et gaudio suo blandiebatur, commovebatque caudam suam.
verses.english: Then the dog, who had been with them on the journey, ran ahead and overtook them with the news, and in his joy, he fawned over them, wagging his tail.

verses.latin: Et exsurgens cæcus pater ejus, cœpit ire titubans pedibus suis. Et cum adhuc iret, apprehendit eum socer ejus.
verses.english: And his blind father, Tobit, got up and began to walk, stumbling with his feet. And while he was still walking, his father-in-law took hold of him.

verses.latin: Et introduxit illum, et osculatus est illum cum lacrimis, et osculata est illum uxor ejus Anna, et filia ejus. Et cœperunt flere omnes simul, et gaudere quod venisset ad eos.
verses.english: And he led him in, and kissed him with tears. And his wife Anna and his daughter also kissed him. And all of them began to weep together, and to rejoice because he had come to them.

verses.latin: Et cum adorassent Dominum, et gratias egissent ei, applicuit Tobias ad patrem suum fellis piscis oculos ejus.
verses.english: And after they had worshipped the Lord and given Him thanks, Tobias applied the fish's gall to his father's eyes.

verses.latin: Et expectavit quasi media hora: et coepit de oculis ejus quasi membrana alba exire.
verses.english: And he waited for about half an hour, and a white film began to come out of his eyes.

verses.latin: Et apprehendit Tobias manum suam, et extraxit illam de oculis ejus, et statim visum recepit.
verses.english: And Tobias took hold of the film with his hand and pulled it out of his eyes, and immediately he regained his sight.

verses.latin: Et magnificabant Deum ipse, et uxor ejus, et omnes qui illum noverant, et dixerunt: Benedictus es tu Deus noster, qui salvas, et vivificas, et mortificas, et reducis de inferis, et de mortuo vives facis.
verses.english: And Tobit himself, and his wife, and all who knew him, magnified God and said: "Blessed are You, our God, who saves, and gives life, and takes life, and brings back from the grave, and makes the dead live."

verses.latin: Et nunc cognoscimus quia misericordia tua super Israel est in sempiternum.
verses.english: "And now we know that Your mercy is upon Israel forever."

verses.latin: Et dixit Tobit: Ecce video filium meum, et filiam meam, et uxorem tuam, et filios ejus, et cognoscimus te in gaudio tuo, quia liberavit te Dominus.
verses.english: And Tobit said: "Behold, I see my son, and my daughter, and your wife, and her children, and we recognize you in your joy, because the Lord has delivered you."

verses.latin: Et subito exsurgens, egressus est ad portam, et occurrit filio suo.
verses.english: And suddenly getting up, he went out to the gate and met his son.

verses.latin: Et amplexatus est illum, et cum lacrimis osculatus est illum. Et dixit: Benedictus es tu Domine Deus noster, qui salvas, et vivificas, et mortificas, et reducis de inferis.
verses.english: And he embraced him, and kissed him with tears. And he said: "Blessed are You, Lord our God, who saves, and gives life, and takes life, and brings back from the grave."

verses.latin: Et nunc video filium meum Tobiam, et uxorem ejus, et filios ejus.
verses.english: "And now I see my son Tobias, and his wife, and their children."

verses.latin: Et ingressi sunt simul in domum. Et ecce, Anna uxor ejus occurrit illi, et filia ejus, et omnes servi ejus, et ancillae ejus.
verses.english: And they all entered the house together. And behold, Anna his wife came to meet him, and his daughter, and all his servants, and his handmaids.

verses.latin: Et narrantibus illis omnia, quæ eis acciderant, cognovit Tobit quod liberasset Dominus uxorem ejus de periculo, et filiam ejus.
verses.english: And as they narrated all that had happened to them, Tobit learned that the Lord had delivered his wife from danger, and his daughter.

verses.latin: Et magnificabant Deum omnes simul, et dixerunt: Benedictus es tu Deus noster, qui salvas, et vivificas, et mortificas, et reducis de inferis, et de mortuo vives facis.
verses.english: And all of them together magnified God and said: "Blessed are You, our God, who saves, and gives life, and takes life, and brings back from the grave, and makes the dead live."

verses.latin: Post haec vocavit Tobias angelum secum, quem putabat hominem, et dixit ei: Azaria frater, quid dabo tibi, aut quam dignam recompensationem invenire potero pro his quae fecisti mihi?
verses.english: After these events, Tobias called the angel who was with him, who he still thought was merely a man, and said to him: “Brother Azariah, what can I give you? Or what worthy reward can I find for all the things you have done for me?”

verses.latin: Tu dux fuisti, et viae itineris mei, tu sublevasti me in periculo, tu Azaram uxorem mihi procurasti, tu pecuniam recepisti a Gabael, tu denique curasti patrem meum. Quid potero dare tibi pro omnibus his?
verses.english: You were my guide, and showed me the way on my journey; you helped me in danger; you found my wife Sarah for me; you recovered the money from Gabael; and finally, you healed my father. What could I possibly give you for all of these things?

verses.latin: Respondens angelus ad illos, dixit: Ego scio quoniam omnia vera vos loquimini, et omnia ex corde vestro haec confitemini.
verses.english: The angel answered them and said: “I know that all of your words are true, and that you confess all of these things from your heart.”

verses.latin: Nunc ergo est tempus ut confitear vobis, et abscondam nihil.
verses.english: “Therefore, now it is time for me to reveal myself to you and to hide nothing.”

verses.latin: Nam quando ivisti cum patre tuo, et sepelisti mortuum: similiter et quando lavisti, et prandisti, et reliquisti prandium tuum, et in fossam mortui nudus introisti, et sepelisti illum, ego missus eram ut tentarem te.
verses.english: “For when you went with your father, and buried the dead—likewise, when you washed yourself, and ate, and then left your meal, and went into the grave of the dead man without clothes, and buried him—I was sent on a mission to test you.”

verses.latin: Et rursum cum oraretis tu et Sara, ego obtuli orationem vestram in conspectu claritatis Domini.
verses.english: “And again, when you and Sarah prayed, I offered your prayer before the glory of the Lord.”

verses.latin: Et quia acceptus eras Deo, necesse fuit ut tentatio probaret te.
verses.english: “And because you were acceptable to God, it was necessary that temptation would prove your worth.”

verses.latin: Et nunc misit me Dominus ut curarem te, et Saram uxorem tuam a daemonio liberarem.
verses.english: “And now the Lord has sent me on this mission so that I might heal you and free Sarah, your wife, from the demon.”

verses.latin: Ego enim sum Raphael angelus, unus ex septem qui astamus ante Dominum.
verses.english: “For I am Raphael, the angel, one of the seven who stand before the Lord.”

verses.latin: Tunc turbati sunt ambo, et ceciderunt in faciem suam, et timuerunt valde.
verses.english: Then both of them were greatly disturbed, and they fell on their faces, and were exceedingly afraid.

verses.latin: Et dixit illis angelus: Nolite timere, pax vobiscum est. Omnia quaecumque operati estis bona, benedicite Dominum, et cantate illi.
verses.english: And the angel said to them: “Do not be afraid; peace be with you. For all the good things you have done, bless the Lord, and sing praises to Him.”

verses.latin: Quia ego non mea aliqua gratia, sed ex voluntate Dei nostri veni. Propter quod benedicite eum in saeculum.
verses.english: “For I did not come by my own power or grace, but by the will of our God. Therefore, bless Him forever.”

verses.latin: Omnes autem dies meos videbam. Et manducabam, et bibebam, et sumentibus vobis cibum, et potum, videbam vobis, sed ego carne non vescebar, sed visione.
verses.english: “Throughout all my days, I appeared to you. And I ate and drank with you, and as you were taking food and drink, I was present to you, but I did not eat flesh; rather, I sustained myself by spiritual vision.”

verses.latin: Nunc ergo tempus est ut revertar ad eum qui me misit: vos autem benedicite Deum, et narrate omnia mirabilia ejus.
verses.english: “Now, therefore, it is time for me to return to Him who sent me on this mission. As for you, bless God and tell of all His wonderful deeds.”

verses.latin: Et cum haec dixisset, ablatus est ab oculis eorum, et amplius non viderunt eum.
verses.english: And when he had said these things, he was taken away from their sight, and they saw him no more.

verses.latin: Tunc prostrati in terram, benedixerunt Deum, et surgentes, narraverunt omnia mirabilia ejus, qualiter apparuerit eis angelus Dei.
verses.english: Then, prostrating themselves on the ground, they blessed God, and rising up, they recounted all His wonderful deeds, how the angel of God had appeared to them.

verses.latin: Et dixit Tobias patri suo: Quantum debemus dare ei? aut quam dignam dignitatem poterimus tribuere?
verses.english: And Tobias said to his father: “How much should we give him? Or what worthy honor can we bestow upon him?”

verses.latin: Nam si dederimus ei medietatem omnium rerum quae allatae sunt, nequaquam dignus est.
verses.english: “For if we were to give him half of all the things we brought back, it would not be nearly enough for his worth.”

verses.latin: Nam et uxorem mihi reduxit salvam, et pecuniam a Gabael recepit, et te curavit, et me ab omnibus periculis liberavit.
verses.english: “For he brought my wife back to me safely, and recovered the money from Gabael, and healed you, and delivered me from all dangers.”

verses.latin: Igitur cogitans haec, clamans vocavit eum, et dixit illi: Azaria frater, accipe medietatem omnium quae allata sunt, et vade cum bono, et pace, et benedictio Domini sit tecum.
verses.english: Therefore, considering all these things, he called out to him and said to him: “Brother Azariah, take half of all the things that have been brought, and go with all good things and peace, and may the blessing of the Lord be with you.”

verses.latin: Et factum est vespere et mane, dies quintus.
verses.english: And the evening and morning passed—the fifth day. —This appears to be an error in the Clementine Vulgate, copied from Genesis 1.

verses.latin: Igitur Tobias vocavit eum, et dixit illi: Azaria frater, accipe medietatem omnium quae allata sunt, et vade cum bono, et pace, et benedictio Domini sit tecum.
verses.english: So Tobias called him and said to him: “Brother Azariah, take half of all the things that have been brought, and go with all good things and peace, and may the blessing of the Lord be with you.”

verses.latin: Tunc Tobias orans sic cœpit dicere: Benedictus es, Domine, Deus Israel, et benedictum nomen tuum in sæcula sæculorum.
verses.english: Then Tobias began to pray, saying this: 'Blessed are You, Lord, God of Israel, and blessed is Your name for all ages to come, forever and ever.'

verses.latin: quia tu flagellas, et salvas, deducis ad inferos, et reducis: et non est qui effugiat manum tuam.
verses.english: 'For You punish, and You save; You bring down to the realm of the dead, and You bring back up from it; and no one can escape Your powerful hand.'

verses.latin: Confitemini illi, filii Israel, et in conspectu Gentium laudate eum:
verses.english: 'Acknowledge Him, O children of Israel, and praise Him in the sight of the non-Jewish nations.'

verses.latin: quoniam ideo dispersit vos inter Gentes, quæ ignorant eum, ut vos enarretis mirabilia ejus, et faciatis scire eos, quia non est alius Deus omnipotens præter eum.
verses.english: 'For this reason, He scattered you among the nations that do not know Him, so that you might proclaim His marvelous deeds, and make them understand that there is no other Almighty God besides Him.'

verses.latin: Ipse quidem flagellavit nos propter iniquitates nostras: et ipse salvabit nos propter misericordiam suam.
verses.english: 'He certainly punished us because of our sins; and He Himself will save us because of His mercy.'

verses.latin: Videte ergo quæ fecit nobiscum, et cum timore et tremore confitemini illi: Regemque sæculorum exaltate in operibus vestris.
verses.english: 'Therefore, see what He has done with us, and with fear and trembling, give Him thanks. Exalt the King of all ages in your every action.'

verses.latin: Ego in terra captivitatis meæ confiteor illi: quoniam ostendit majestatem suam in gente peccatrice.
verses.english: 'I, in the land where I am held captive, give Him thanks; because He has shown His majesty among a sinful people.'

verses.latin: Convertimini igitur, peccatores, et facite justitiam coram illo, credentes, quod faciat vobiscum misericordiam suam.
verses.english: 'Therefore, turn back, you sinners, and do what is right before Him, believing that He will show you His mercy.'

verses.latin: Ego, et anima mea, lætamur in illo.
verses.english: 'I, and my very soul, rejoice in Him.'

verses.latin: Benedicite, omnes electi ejus, diebus lætitiæ, et confitemini illi.
verses.english: 'Bless Him, all His chosen ones, on days of joy, and give Him thanks.'

verses.latin: Jerusalem civitas Dei, ædificabit te Dominus in æternum: Igitur jucundare de operibus tuis.
verses.english: 'O Jerusalem, city of God, the Lord will rebuild you forever. Therefore, rejoice in your restored state and your good deeds.'

verses.latin: Confiteri tibi justi, et benedicent nomen sanctum tuum.
verses.english: 'The righteous will give thanks to you, and they will bless your holy name.'

verses.latin: Beati erunt qui in te turbulati sunt in omnibus: Beati qui de omnibus gloriabuntur in te, et gloriabuntur de pœnis tuis.
verses.english: 'Blessed will be those who were afflicted within you, in all things; blessed are those who will boast in you above all others, and will boast about the punishments you endured.'

verses.latin: Exaltabit animas eorum, et jucundabuntur in salute ejus.
verses.english: 'He will lift up their souls, and they will rejoice in His salvation.'

verses.latin: Benedictus Dominus in omnibus operibus suis, et benedictus in æternum: Ut ædificet tabernaculum tuum in gaudio.
verses.english: 'Blessed be the Lord in all His works, and blessed forever: So that He may rebuild your temple with joy.'

verses.latin: Et in te sit jucundum omnium sæculorum: et exsultent in te omnes justi de sæculo in sæculum.
verses.english: 'And in you may there be joy throughout all ages; and let all the righteous exult in you, from one age to the next.'

verses.latin: Dantibus confessionem nomini tuo in sæculum sæculi: Quoniam electi erunt in omnibus operibus suis.
verses.english: 'Giving praise to Your name for ever and ever; because they will be chosen in all their works.'

verses.latin: Et benedictus es tu, Rex magnus, quoniam in te ædificabitur Jerusalem, civitas tua, in omnibus operibus suis, sicut locutus est Isaias de te.
verses.english: 'And blessed are You, great King, because in You Jerusalem, Your city, will be rebuilt in all its works, just as Isaiah spoke concerning you.'

verses.latin: Et aperiens Tobias os suum benedixit Dominum, et dixit:
verses.english: And Tobias began to praise the Lord by saying:

verses.latin: Benedictus Dominus, qui vivit in saecula:
verses.english: "Blessed is the Lord, who lives forever, through all ages.

verses.latin: et in omnia regnum ipsius.
verses.english: And His Kingdom extends over all things.

verses.latin: Ipse enim flagellat, et miseretur: deducit usque ad inferos, et reducit:
verses.english: For He disciplines His people and then shows mercy. He brings souls down to the abode of the dead and then brings them back to life.

verses.latin: et nemo est qui effugiat manum ejus.
verses.english: And there is no one who can escape His hand and power.

verses.latin: Confitemini illi, filii Israel, et in conspectu Gentium laudate eum:
verses.english: O children of Israel, give thanks to Him, and praise Him in the sight of all the nations.

verses.latin: quoniam ideo dispersit vos inter gentes, quæ ignorant eum, ut vos enarretis mirabilia ejus, et faciatis scire eos, quoniam non est alius Deus præter eum.
verses.english: For this reason, He has scattered you among the nations who do not know Him: so that you may declare His wondrous works, and make them know that there is no other God except Him.

verses.latin: Ipse castigavit nos propter iniquitates nostras: et ipse salvabit nos propter miserationem suam.
verses.english: He Himself disciplined us because of our sins, and He Himself will save us because of His mercy.

verses.latin: Confitemini Domino, et magnificate regem saeculorum: et excipietis ab illo salutem in laetitia.
verses.english: Give thanks to the Lord and exalt the King of all ages, and you will receive salvation from Him with great joy.

verses.latin: Jerusalem civitas Dei, flagellabit te Dominus in operibus manuum tuarum,
verses.english: O Jerusalem, city of God, the Lord will punish you for the works of your hands,

verses.latin: et rursus miserebitur tui per opera manuum justorum.
verses.english: but then He will again have mercy on you through the works of the righteous.

verses.latin: Confitemini Domino in bono, et benedicite regi saeculorum, ut ædificetur tabernaculum ejus in te cum gaudio. Et lætificet in te Dominus omnes miseros, et exaltet in te omnes destructos in generationes saeculi.
verses.english: Give thanks to the Lord with goodness, and bless the King of all ages, so that His dwelling place in you may be rebuilt with joy. And may the Lord gladden all the miserable in you, and lift up all the downtrodden for generations to come.

verses.latin: Inluminare Jerusalem civitas Dei: et excipiet omnia munera in bono. Et erit tibi laetitia in generatione saeculi.
verses.english: Be enlightened, O Jerusalem, city of God, and you will receive all gifts with goodness. And there will be joy for you for generations throughout time.

verses.latin: Accedent ad te nationes ex longinquo in lumine tuo: et munera deferentes, adorantes Dominum in te, et terram tuam in sanctificatione habentes.
verses.english: Nations will come to you from afar, drawn by your light, bringing gifts and worshipping the Lord in you, and they will hold your land as sacred.

verses.latin: Omnes vicinitates generationum tuarum benedicent te, et accipient magnam benedictionem.
verses.english: All the surrounding peoples of your generations will bless you, and they will receive a great blessing.

verses.latin: Exaltare et conlaudare nomina eorum, qui cum gaudio lætificati sunt in te. Exaltare et conlaudare et omnes homines qui efficiunt pacem in te.
verses.english: Rejoice and praise the names of those who have been made joyful in you. Rejoice and praise all the people who bring about peace in you.

verses.latin: Benedictus Dominus, qui exaltavit te, et sit regnum ejus in te per omnia saecula saeculorum. Amen.
verses.english: Blessed be the Lord, who has exalted you, and may His kingdom be in you through all ages of ages. Amen.

verses.latin: Multi venient de longinquo, et habitantes in nomine Domini Dei, munera secum afferentes, et munera regi caeli. Generationes generationum in te exsultabunt, et nomen civitatis electae in saecula saeculorum.
verses.english: Many will come from afar, dwelling in the name of the Lord God, bringing gifts with them, and offerings to the King of the universe. Generations of generations will rejoice in you, and the name of the chosen city will remain through all ages.

verses.latin: Maledicti omnes qui oderunt te: et benedicti omnes qui diligunt te in omnia saecula.
verses.english: Cursed are all who hate you, and blessed are all who love you for all ages.

verses.latin: In omnibus exsultabunt, et benedicent te.
verses.english: In all things, they will rejoice and bless you.

verses.latin: Consummatus est itaque dies Tobiae in gaudio, et profectus est cum timore Dei in viis ejus.
verses.english: So, Tobias lived out the rest of his days in joy. He continued to walk in the ways of God, filled with reverence for Him.

verses.latin: Cum esset annorum centum duodecim, et filius ejus Tobias sexaginta duorum, mortuus est in gloria.
verses.english: When he was one hundred and twelve years old, and his son Tobias was sixty-two, he died in glory—a blessed death.

verses.latin: Magis autem lætatus est super auditum de Nineve, quia destructa est: et vidit captivos ductos ex ea in Mediam ab Assuero rege Persarum. Et benedixit Dominum Deum in omnibus his quæ fecit in filiis prævaricationis et in impiis.
verses.english: However, he rejoiced even more at the news of Nineveh's destruction. He also lived to see the captives from Nineveh being led into Media by Ahasuerus, the King of the Persians. And Tobias blessed the Lord God for everything He had done to the disobedient and the wicked.

verses.latin: Et priusquam moreretur, vocavit Tobiam filium suum, et septem juvenes filios ejus, et dixit eis: Videte, filii, quomodo Ninive destruetur, et complebitur verbum Domini quod locutus est per prophetas Israhel.
verses.english: And before he died, he called his son Tobias and his seven young grandsons, and he said to them: "My sons, take note of how Nineveh will be destroyed, and how the word of the Lord, which He spoke through the prophets of Israel, will be fulfilled."

verses.latin: Et credite omnia quæ locutus est Deus per prophetas Israhel, quoniam venient, et non cadet ex omnibus verbo uno.
verses.english: "And believe all that God has spoken through the prophets of Israel, because these things will surely come to pass, and not one word from them will fail."

verses.latin: Et omnes fratres nostri, qui sunt in terra Israël, dispergentur per omnes fines terræ suæ.
verses.english: "And all our brethren, who are in the land of Israel, will be scattered throughout all the borders of their own land."

verses.latin: Sicut autem dispergentur, sic et congregabuntur rursum: et reducentur in terram Israël.
verses.english: "But just as they will be scattered, so too will they be gathered again. They will be brought back into the land of Israel."

verses.latin: Et ædificabunt templum Dei in ea, non sicut prius, sed majus, et gloriosius.
verses.english: "And they will rebuild the Temple of God there—not as it was before, but larger and more glorious."

verses.latin: Et revertentur omnes qui in captivitate sunt in Israël, et habitabunt in domo domini.
verses.english: "And all who are in captivity from Israel will return, and they will live in the house of the Lord."

verses.latin: Et non erit populus in ea, nisi per multa sæcula: et post hæc, ædificabitur civitas, et templum gloriosius erit.
verses.english: "And there will be no true nation there for many generations; but after these times, the city will be rebuilt, and the Temple will be even more glorious."

verses.latin: Et omnes qui fugerant, revertentur in eam.
verses.english: "And all who had fled will return to it."

verses.latin: Et omnes nationes convertentur ad Dominum Deum veritatis, et dimittent idola sua.
verses.english: "And all nations will turn to the Lord God of truth, and they will abandon their idols."

verses.latin: Et benedicent Dominum Deum in omnibus, et exaltabunt illum in omni loco terræ suæ.
verses.english: "And they will bless the Lord God in all things, and they will exalt Him in every place throughout their land."

verses.latin: Et glorificabunt eum, et omnes gentes simul, et omnis creatura quæ est in cœlo, et quæ est in terra, laudabunt illum in omni opere ejus.
verses.english: "And they will glorify Him, and all the nations together, and every creature that is in the sky and that is on the earth will praise Him in all His works."

verses.latin: Et erit pax et salus omnibus sanctis. Amen.
verses.english: "And there will be peace and salvation for all the saints. Amen."

verses.latin: Consummata sunt ergo omnia verba Tobiae, et sanus effectus est, et annos centum duodecim vixit, et vidit filios filiorum suorum quintam generationem.
verses.english: And so, everything Tobit had prophesied came to pass. After his sight was restored, he lived for one hundred and twelve years, and he was blessed to see his children's children, even to the fifth generation of his descendants.

verses.latin: Et abiit in Media ad Anniam suam, et habitavit cum ea, et senuit in pace.
verses.english: Then he went to Media, to his wife Anna, and lived with her, and grew old in peace, surrounded by his family.

verses.latin: Et ante mortem suam vocavit filium suum Tobiam, et sex filios filii sui, et admonuit eos, et dixit eis:
verses.english: Before his death, he called his son Tobias and his six grandchildren—the sons of Tobias—and instructed them, saying:

verses.latin: Fili, festina, et vade in Mediam, quia credo sermoni Domini, quem locutus est per Nahum prophetam de Ninive, quia fiet ita sicut locutus est, et erit destructio magna civitatis illius ad tempus.
verses.english: “My son, make haste and go to Media, for I believe the word of the Lord, which He spoke through the prophet Nahum concerning Nineveh. It will happen exactly as He said, and there will be a great destruction of that city for a time, as foretold by God.”

verses.latin: Et scio quia quicumque ex terra Israel ibi permanserint, soli dispersi erunt, et omnes captivi erunt ex bona terra, et venient in Mediam.
verses.english: “And I know that whoever from the land of Israel remains there will be scattered abroad and all will be taken captive from their good land, and they will come into Media.”

verses.latin: Et rursus in omnibus hi qui in terra Israel fuerint, recordabuntur Dei, et revertentur ex omnibus dispersionibus suis, et ædificabunt Jerusalem, et domum Dei in ea, sed non qualem primo fuerat, usque ad plenitudinem temporum generationis.
verses.english: “And again, all those who are in the land of Israel will remember God, and they will return from all their places of dispersion, and they will rebuild Jerusalem and the house of God within it, but not as it was at first, until the fullness of the times of the generation comes.”

verses.latin: Et post hæc revertentur omnes de captivitate sua, et ædificabunt Jerusalem magnificenter, et domus Dei in ea, sicut locutus est de illa, ædificabitur in omnibus generationibus, ædificium magnificum.
verses.english: “And after this, all will return from their captivity, and they will rebuild Jerusalem magnificently. The house of God within it, as He spoke concerning it, will be built for all generations, a magnificent structure.”

verses.latin: Et omnes qui timent Dominum, omni veritate ædificabunt eam, et relinquentes omnes idola sua, et blasphemias suas, et omnes populi benedicent Domino.
verses.english: “And all who fear the Lord will rebuild it in all truth. They will abandon all their idols and their blasphemies, and all the peoples will bless the Lord.”

verses.latin: Et erit omnis populus, confessus, et exaltans Deum omnis populus ejus, in sæcula sæculorum.
verses.english: “And all the people will confess and exalt God, His entire people, for all ages.”

verses.latin: Et omnes qui faciunt justitiam, in omni terra in illo tempore benedicent Domino, et exaltabunt omnes qui timent Dominum, in eo omnes in veritate, et in memoriam habentes peccata nostra.
verses.english: “And all who practice justice throughout the whole world in that time will bless the Lord. All who fear the Lord will exalt Him in it, all of them in truth, and remembering our sins for His mercy.”

verses.latin: Et nunc, filii, audite patrem vestrum, et servite Domino in veritate, et inquirite ut faciatis quæ illi placita sunt.
verses.english: “And now, children, listen to your father, and serve the Lord in truth, and seek to do what is pleasing to Him.”

verses.latin: Et non inquiratis ut iniqui permaneatis, nec transgrediamini praeceptum ejus.
verses.english: “Do not seek to remain in wickedness, nor transgress His commandment.”

verses.latin: Omnibus diebus vitæ vestræ, fili, habete Deum in sensu vestro, et cavete ne aliquando peccetis, nec relinquatis praecepta ejus.
verses.english: “All the days of your life, my son, keep God in your mind, and be careful never to sin, nor to abandon His commandments.”

verses.latin: In omnibus diebus vitæ tuæ, fac bonum, et non inquiras quod malum est.
verses.english: “In all the days of your life, do good, and do not seek what is evil.”

verses.latin: Et habitavit Tobias annos centum decem et septem, et vidit filios filiorum suorum antequam moreretur, septem, et transmigravit cum gloria, et omnis Israel planxit illum.
verses.english: And Tobias lived for one hundred and seventeen years, and he saw seven of his grandchildren before he died. He passed away in glory, and all of Israel mourned him. (This chapter continues with the details of Tobias the younger.)
